item.title: Introduction to Music Theory
item.description:
# WHY: Why

# WHAT: What

# Staff (Five-line staff to Grand staff)

  • Position for notes: on (a/1st-5th line), and in (a/1st-4th) space; ledger lines (Notes above/below the staff)
    • Composition for notes: (open/filled-in) noteheads, beam, flag
  • Sound for notes: Pitches (Frequency Positive Relative: High and Lows/Ascending and Descending motion/notes)
    • The ascending and descending motion with time compose a contour
    • Letter name: Middle C
      • Step: half(C - C#), whole(C# - D#), octave(eight steps)
      • Leap: a nonadjacent white key (C-E, D-F)
    • Clef(Key): Treble, Bass, Alto, Tenor
    • Accidentals: sharp($\sharp$), flat($\flat$), natural ($\natural$enharmonic equivalents)

# Rhythm & meter

  • Rhythm: Whole note - half note - quarter note - eighth - sixteenth - thirty-second
  • Meter: time signature; beat; bar(mearsure) & barline;
  • 4/4ï¼š Downbeat strong - weak - semistrong - Upbeat weak
  • tempo
  • Rest
  • Argumentation dot
